body.p: Governor,, Magoffin I some time since sent you a petition for Mr, Maymard, asking you to remit, the forfeiture of his bond; this you did no answer there having since that been a judgement, I hope you will now interpose, it is and will be oppressive, on him to pay the costs,

I forwarded a petition to you, asking you to remit the forfeiture of a bond for $250. -- entered into by Jere Davidson, George N Brown and myself, for the appearance, of J. B. R. Watkins, from Mo, at the last Oct or Nov Term of the Greenup circuit Court; there was scarcely any such thing as his getting through the lines; can you not give us a court or two after one termination of the war, by respiting the forfeiture, this we ask as a matter of grace, so that the party may have an opportunity to answer, we ask your clemency; Jas M. Rice Geo, N, Brown, Jer. Davidson,

Greenup cir ct
$250 } For.
Issd May 13. 1862
